thread.title: Perth radio star Shane McFarlane dead at 53
thread.title_full: Perth radio star Shane McFarlane dead at 53

author: Jenna Clarke
title: Perth radio star Shane McFarlane dead at 53
text:
Dean Clairs, Shane McFarlane and Kymba Cahill from Mix 94.5 and Perth's top rating breakfast radio show. Photo: Facebook 
Perth radio presenter Shane McFarlane has died following ongoing health issues.
The Mix 94.5 breakfast announcer had been on long service leave since mid-September and passed away on Wednesday.
McFarlane co-hosted Perth's No. 1 commercial breakfast show alongside Dean Clairs and Kymba Cahill. 
Clairs and Cahill were not on air on Friday morning.
Advertisement "It is with a heavy heart that we share the news that our beloved Shane McFarlane has passed away due to complications from ongoing gastric issues," general manager of Southern Cross Austereo Perth Linda Wayman said.
"Shane has been part of the Mix 94.5 family for 14 years and will leave an enormous hole in our hearts and on our airwaves. We extend our deepest sympathy to his family and friends and welcome your messages of support and love. Rest in Peace Shane. We will miss you mate."
McFarlane was 53 and began his broadcasting career in WA's north west. He also graced the FM airwaves in Noosa and Canberra before returning home to Perth and joining SCA in 2000.
It is with a heavy heart that we share the news that our beloved Shane McFarlane has passed away due to complications...
Posted by Mix 94.5 on  Thursday, October 8, 2015 He is survived by his young son.
Those wishing to share their condolences are encouraged to do so on the network's Facebook page .
McFarlane's peers paid tribute to him at the National Radio Conference, being held on Friday on the Gold Coast.
More to come.
